text: We've run an industry newsletter sponsorship before, directing readers to a landing page with ungated content. The goal was to get new leads through form fills (or at least get them to wander around the website) but it wasn't successful - didn't get many click-throughs or leads generated and thus didn't justify anything close to the price. Next time we'd be much more rigorous with scoping out sponsors - asking more about their audience size and engagement, historical performance, etc. In my experience, industry newsletters don't have a great rep - at least the large ones with over, say, 80k subscribers - as the audience quality tends to diminish fast.

text: :raised_hands: Yes to all of this :raised_hands:  Especially with #5 - I see so many clients want to create, create, create... and then just leave content to lie there once it's published. Marketing your content is just as important as creating it.

text: Thanks for the insights Vicky! That makes sense. Smaller lists would definitely be ideal. I'd love to sponsor some that are between 5-10k readers.
